column5:
YES YES YES YES YES, a million times yes! My SO had a friendly relationship with his BM, and she would randomly text him asking things that were none of her business and he would give her info like it was nothing, because he was used to it considering they were married for so long. I had a lot of jealousy in our relationship for a very very long time, but this wasn‚Äôt even jealousy, this just felt plain weird to me. Why does she need to know if you‚Äôre at a specific restaurant because she drove by and thought she saw your vehicle? Why does she need to know how your visit with your long-lost dad went? She doesn‚Äôt need to. It was a constant issue that he saw as jealousy but it was not jealousy, it was just so strange and just not normal to me, and his response was always ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt feel that I‚Äôm normal‚Äù or ‚Äúwhy is not normal not good?‚Äù ‚ÄúWhy do we have to be normal?‚Äù 

Made no sense then and still makes no sense to me now even though he‚Äôs finally ended all of that because, after a YEAR of me being uncomfortable, he finally thought of it from my point of view. 

I can‚Äôt explain it. Never had the words for it until you posted this and I thank you for it.
Surgery isn‚Äôt going to stop me from drinking, ever

Same. Seriously, same. Take this even from an alcoholic, get the fuck out of there NOW. There is absolutely nothing you can do, unfortunately. Nothing.

And this is why my mom and stepdad have no problem with my 18 year old sister living with them forever (as she‚Äôs expressed she plans to do) with no job, no license and no car. They never worked on their marriage. Everything was about me and my stepsister and half sister. When my step sister and I both moved out, my mom was a wreck and she and my stepdad fought constantly, because they don‚Äôt know how to be around each other. They don‚Äôt know what a marriage looks like because they‚Äôve never tried to focus on one. They only focused on us. Fast forward to my half sister getting older and now she and my mom are best friends. If my sister ever did leave, I‚Äôd pretty much guarantee that my parents would end up divorcing.

Jesus Christ this sounds like my former relationship, except SO wouldn‚Äôt set boundaries and wanted BM in his life, so after almost a year of trying to get him to set boundaries and failing at it, I left. Miss my SK‚Äôs so much, luckily he still brings them over to see me pretty often.
Can you send it to me also? I‚Äôm extremely interested!
I needed this. Thank you.
Thank you!
Thank you!
Kelly, you insulted the man, apologize.
Bet you‚Äôd like to swim with this sea monster.
Thank you!

Good god, this is me to a T. It sucks, so so so bad. It ended my engagement. My worry was too much for him. I genuinely understand what you‚Äôre going through, and I hope you can find peace throughout this.

I have been this way for as long as I can remember. I constantly think my friends and my spouse are angry at me, even though they absolutely aren‚Äôt. It‚Äôs been a really troubling issue that I possess. It was a giant factor in the ending of my engagement. He told me if I ever need reassurance, just ask and he will give it to me. I asked too much. He eventually couldn‚Äôt take it. 
I always am paranoid and worried that people are angry with me and question it and question it until it gets so annoying that they don‚Äôt want to be around me. 

I wish I knew how to fix this. Luckily I started therapy last week for the first time since I was a child, and I‚Äôm hoping I can work through this. I get where you‚Äôre coming from, and with help, hopefully it will get better.

SAME. 
I‚Äôve now given up and accepted that if I appear desperate, I just appear desperate. Not much I can do about it. It took me years to finally be comfortable with it.

I‚Äôm so glad it is working out for you! I was in the same spot. We had quite a few other problems, but one of my main issues was that SO didn‚Äôt parent his kids. They‚Äôd leave food out for days, dishes piled high, spilled drinks all over the floor, food crushed into the couch, etc. I tried to talk to him about it multiple times, and he‚Äôd always say he would be on it from then on. But never was. So I had my last straw and stopped cleaning up their shit. Now, I have my own daughter, and she is 6. His kids are 10 and 11. My daughter ALWAYS cleans up after herself because she was raised that way. She does not leave a mess anywhere she goes. But SO‚Äôs kids, I‚Äôd give them a parade if I watched them even take their plate to the sink after dinner. 

Didn‚Äôt work out well for me. I was viewed to him as judging his parenting (which I was) and disrespecting how he raises them. It led to him ultimately not respecting me and basically not wanting to be around me at all to the point where I left about a week ago.

Now, my new house is sparkling clean. It looks great, it smells great, my daughter and I are going to be happy after this small adjustment period. But I know I don‚Äôt have to put up with anyone‚Äôs messes anymore and looked at like friggin Hitler just by asking them to clean up their mess.

Thanks guys. Yeah, at my next appointment I will bring it up. This morning, right when I woke up, it was just horrible. I was shaking so bad while trying to get ready. I hadn‚Äôt even taken my medication yet. It got a little better throughout the day, but it still hasn‚Äôt stopped and now it‚Äôs 8:30pm. It‚Äôs definitely better than it was this morning though.

I‚Äôve lost 30lbs since my anxiety developed about 8 months ago. I pretty much never have a desire to eat. I either forget about food, literally don‚Äôt think about eating, and I‚Äôll go 2-3 days doing that. Or I‚Äôll be too nauseous to eat. I try to eat a meal every day now that I‚Äôve recognized it, but sometimes it just doesn‚Äôt happen. So yes, I definitely understand what you‚Äôre going through.
This is exactly how I feel. Was talking to my mom about this exact thing yesterday.
That‚Äôs my bad. I don‚Äôt know the acronyms. They‚Äôre 10 and 11.

Thank you for your input. His reasoning makes sense to me, but for some reason, I can‚Äôt get past the fact it‚Äôs strange from going to engaged and living together to living apart. He says he doesn‚Äôt care about what seems strange or what‚Äôs normal but what‚Äôs good for us. So this is the type of advice that is extremely helpful.

Thank you everyone for your input! I found three great pairs of dress pants from Kohl‚Äôs on sale and one pair at Target. TJ Maxx was not of much help as I had hoped, but honestly I‚Äôm just pretty picky about pants. Just glad I found some!

Your response is so positive and kind! I thank you so much. I also am always cold, so I‚Äôm going to have to incorporate some cardigans into my attire. I‚Äôve looked into tailors in my area and thankfully have a few within a few miles of me. I do agree that I should adhere to my new Boss‚Äôs expectations to even at least get a good impression and image of myself in the workplace.
Man, y‚Äôall obviously aren‚Äôt from the south.
That would be macaroni pasta with (I don‚Äôt know what sauce) and Parmesan.
Is this Turkey Leg Hut in Houston? Because if so, god damn I‚Äôve been dying to go. Everything they make is giant, over the top, and looks delicious.

I don‚Äôt have an Express near me, but I do have an Old Navy and definitely didn‚Äôt think of that! Thank you! I never shop there. I know I was going to try TJ Maxx, Target, and then Kohl‚Äôs as a last resort, simply because if they don‚Äôt have a sale going on, it can get pricey.

I tried setting boundaries. It doesn‚Äôt seem to work. He knew I wouldn‚Äôt be ok with it and said so himself, so he said we would talk about it. But with the talk came the whole ‚Äúthis is how it‚Äôs going to be, the conclusion we came to today is a bandaid for an issue we will continue to have because I want to do this.‚Äù

I would like to reiterate that I do not believe he is going to cheat on me. Do I worry about it? Yes, extremely often. My anxiety has gotten the best of me. But in my heart I don‚Äôt entirely believe he would cheat on me with her as he has made it very clear that he has no feelings for her whatsoever and simply just wants to coparent, even though I don‚Äôt understand his methods. But that‚Äôs not my true worry. My true worry is that him spending time with her alone will have her start to manipulate him into including more time with them co-parenting their kids and pushing me out of the co-parenting picture, as she doesn‚Äôt seem to like me being around and has made it very clear several times. She wants them to parent their kids and doesn‚Äôt want me to even slightly be a parent to them, so she wants to do things alone with him and their kids. I know in my heart that he doesn‚Äôt have romantic or sexual feelings towards his ex wife, but there‚Äôs still a connection there unfortunately, and I don‚Äôt know how to deal with it.

I do truly believe he is over her, but my concern is that she is extremely manipulative and being married to her for 12 years, she knows how to get in his head. I don‚Äôt believe she is over him, no matter how often she flaunts her new BF on social media and talks about how much she loves him. I‚Äôm worried if they‚Äôre alone together, she will slowly manipulate him into doing something stupid. And by stupid, I don‚Äôt mean cheat on me, but just find another way to keep me farther away so they can co-parent without me, as she really is not okay with me being around, even though we are civil and she has her own BF. She talks bad about me constantly to their kids, and one of them is a teenager who absolutely loves me and has a horrible relationship with her mom, and she always tells me everything her mom says about me, which I have asked her to stop plenty of times because I don‚Äôt want to hear it. 

He is so blind when it comes to his ex wife‚Äôs actions and always believes she‚Äôs being honest and sincere, when in reality, she always seems to have another agenda.

Yes, that situation was a mess. He was the one who pushed me to file assault charges on her, so I did. However, she started making life difficult for him regarding seeing the kids and told him if he could get me to drop the charges, it would all go back to normal, so I did. And things have been fine since then. Until this, which is really bothering me.

My friend who referred me to this group advised me to ask him, ‚Äúdo you want a family with me or with her?‚Äù And when I asked him this, he didn‚Äôt seem to understand, even though I explained that I didn‚Äôt mean I‚Äôm not asking him to literally leave his family, but that I want to know if he wants to start a family with me or just keep his family with her as it used to be. He literally could not fathom what I was talking about. She is an extremely narcissistic person, and she emotionally abused and manipulated him for 12 years, and he still doesn‚Äôt seem to understand how a healthy relationship works. I try to keep that in mind and explain it to him, but he just literally doesn‚Äôt seem to be able to fathom it.
